For those interested, Czech Republic KVM vps hosting provider Hukot.cz have right this moment 50% off recurring pricing which brings their lowest VPS package to 1.46 € + VAT.
VAT doesn't seems deducted for buyers outside of the EU.  
They state "unmetered" bandwidth and /64 IPv6 subnet by default.   
I am not affiliated with them and I haven't tried their service yet, so I can't say anthing about quality however from time to time I see LET members looking for czech located vps and this seems like a good opportunity to get it for decent price. Don't blame me if things don't go as expected - I just share my finding!   
Offer seems time limited (until 16th April 2014).  



    5 GB disk space
    256 MB RAM (fully alocated)
    CPU XEON E5/E3 / Opteron 6200/6300 (single core)
    100 Mbps connectivity
    unlimited data traffic
    24/7 support
    SMS restart
    KVM/VNC console
    1.46 €

http://www.hukot.net/en/virtual-servery/

Their website state:

>  Currently we offer linux distributions Debian, Gentoo, Ubuntu, CentOS, Scientific, SuSe, Fedora, Elastix in the last stable version; from BSD family we offer FreeBSD and Debian kFreeBSD (Standardly we install 64 bit version - 32bit is also available if demanded) and from Microsoft: Windows XP, Windows 7 (Professional, Enterprise a Ultimate), Windows 2008 R2 Datacenter a Windows 2012 Datacenter - activation of the Windows operating system is directed by the customer.
> 
> Every virutual server is connected with 1Gbps to our network, which has connectivity 2 x 10 Gbps to NIX. Servers are located in own datacenter. 
   
I didn't find much info about them at LET, just those two statements:  
   
> [William said](/discussion/comment/340010/#Comment_340010): Note: The unmetered on hukot is not unmetered.
    
> [salakis said](/discussion/comment/339638/#Comment_339638): I can recommend hukot.net. Their servers are in Česká Třebová. Check the server on speedtest.net by Kabelová Televize CZ s.r.o., should be the same DC.
